mods.abstract: This bundle consists of summaries of official secret letters received, mainly from the Governor General of India in Council (17 June 1857, Number 30; 19 June 1857, Number 31; 19 June 1857, Numbers 32-35), and from Bombay [presumably the Government of Bombay] (24 June 1857, Numbers 128-132; 25 June, Number 133; 27 June, Numbers 134-135; 30 June, Numbers 136-137). The summaries mostly relate to the Indian Mutiny [Rebellion or Uprising], including the situation in Peshawar and the Punjab, troops being sent from Ceylon [Sri Lanka] and Nepal, and the arrest of the King of Oude [Awadh]. The bundle also includes summaries relating to Kelat, Aden, and Persia (including troops being sent from Persia to India).
